bestBHT.bht: They recognized him as the beggar who sat daily asking for alms, and they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: 10. they knew that it was he which
Marvin Vincent: They knew [επεγινωσκον] . Or recognized. Rev., took knowledge. Wonder [θαμβους] . Used by Luke only. See on Luke 4:36.
Amazement [εκστασεως] . See on Mark 5:42; and compare Luke 5:26.
Archibald T. Robertson: They took knowledge of him (επεγινωσκον). Imperfect active, inchoative, began to perceive.
Were filled (επλησθησαν). Effective first aorist passive.
At that which had happened (τω συμβεβηκοτ). Perfect active participle of συμβαινω.
John Gill: They knew him to be that beggar that sat daily and asked alms.
It was a clear and indisputable point with them.
They were all filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.

bhtAttempts.bht: They recognized him as the beggar who sat daily asking for alms, and they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him.
They took knowledge of him, knowing him to be the beggar who sat daily seeking alms. Filled with wonder and amazement, they marveled at the miraculous event that had taken place.
Recognizing him as the beggar who regularly sought alms, they were filled with amazement and wonder at the miraculous event that had occurred.
Recognizing him as the beggar who sat daily seeking alms, they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
They immediately recognized him as the beggar who used to sit for alms, and were filled with astonishment and awe at the incredible transformation that had occurred.
